tournament.name: Friday 9:30 AM - Platinum Event - Card Titan

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own game-winning combo. It plays a control game early on, and once it has the necessary pieces in the graveyard, it goes all-in to bring back powerful threats and secure the victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and Eldrazi creatures to cast powerful spells and artifacts such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Karn's Sylex. The deck utilizes various cards like Once Upon a Time and Crop Rotation to find key pieces, while also having disruption tools like Soul-Guide Lantern and Disruptor Flute. Karn, the Great Creator acts as the deck's toolbox, allowing access to powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to control the game and overwhelm opponents, ultimately leading to a game-winning combo.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of removal, countermagic, and card advantage. Using cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Sheoldred's Edict to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while leveraging powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game. The deck also includes versatile cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Witherbloom Command to generate card advantage and manage resources effectively. By carefully managing their resources and disrupting the opponent's plan, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast their opponents in longer games.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through a combination of rituals, moxen, and Lion's Eye Diamond, allowing for explosive plays. It utilizes cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also using cards like Echo of Eons to refill the hand and keep the combo going. The deck also includes various tutor effects to find key combo pieces when needed. Ultimately, the goal is to cast Tendrils of Agony or another win condition multiple times in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Dread Return to mill the library and win with Thassa's Oracle or Narcomoeba. It uses cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Urza's Saga to search for combo pieces, while control elements like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Teferi, Time Raveler help protect the combo. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, ensuring consistency in executing the combo.

This UWx Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and prevent the opponent from developing their board state. The deck includes ways to protect itself against threats, such as Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with powerful removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and drawing into key cards with Brainstorm and Ponder, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure a victory through attrition.

This Maverick Aggro deck focuses on utilizing creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Endurance, along with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game. Additionally, disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while allowing the deck to maintain its tempo. The inclusion of cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time also provide flexibility and consistency in finding key pieces for the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on generating mana and assembling the Mystic Forge combo to generate card advantage and potentially win the game. It includes various artifacts that can help ramp up mana production and manipulate the top of the library to ensure a smooth combo execution. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Pithing Needle and Karn, the Great Creator to control the board and hinder the opponent's strategy. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Shuko to enable a quick win condition. By using these cards in combination with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom, the deck aims to quickly mill through the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck is also supported by control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and consistency to the deck.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares, Thoughtseize, and Skyclave Apparition, the deck can deal with threats efficiently. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for flash creatures like Flickerwisp and Containment Priest to be played at instant speed. Stoneforge Mystic can search for equipment like Kaldra Compleat to further enhance the aggro strategy. The deck also benefits from the synergy between Recruiter of the Guard and various powerful creatures to maintain board presence and control the game.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with disruption spells to control the pace of the game and pressure the opponent's resources. By using cheap spells like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Fatal Push alongside card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's gameplan while deploying threats quickly. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Murktide Regent provide additional utility and late-game power. With a mix of tempo plays and efficient removal, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and secure a victory through aggressive pressure.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. It also utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly deploy threats and close out the game. The deck seeks to limit opponent's options and prevent them from effectively casting spells, while efficiently dealing damage and controlling the game tempo.

The deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board and hand while using card advantage to maintain the upper hand. By efficiently managing threats and answers, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can deploy powerful finishers like Barrowgoyf, Murktide Regent, and planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Narset. The combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw ensures that the deck can handle a wide range of threats and strategies, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on utilizing the card "Show and Tell" to cheat out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. By using cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana, along with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats early in the game. With the ability to quickly drop game-winning creatures into play, the deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent in order to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and disrupting the opponent's hand with a combination of fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal, along with disruptive spells like Duress and Thoughtseize. The main win condition is a storm combo using cards like Infernal Tutor and Tendrils of Agony to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. The deck also includes Wishclaw Talisman for additional tutoring and search options, alongside cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to further accelerate the deck's explosive potential.

This UR Aggro deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck is built to be versatile, with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student providing card advantage and Mishra's Bauble providing additional information. Lightning Bolt and other removal spells help keep the opponent's board in check, allowing the deck to quickly close out games with aggressive creatures. The deck also includes some disruptive elements with spells like Surgical Extraction and Spell Pierce.
